name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
The air in Aimé's room was thick with iron and clove. The scent of blood clung to him—seeped into the stitching of his dress shirt, pooled beneath his fingernails, nestled warm into the grooves of his skin like it belonged there. Aimé didn’t flinch. He never did. He peeled the shirt off his back slowly, methodically, wincing only when the fabric dragged across the half-healed scrape beneath his ribs. A gift from tonight. A final scratch from a dying man.

He set the shirt down with care. Folded it. His hands were too big for that sort of delicate work, but he moved gently, reverently. There were holes near the cuff where the ex-boyfriend had tried to claw himself away—desperation always looked the same. Ugly. Human.

It was still early. Late enough that the estate was silent, but early enough that the sky hadn’t started whispering light. He moved through the quiet like a shadow with shape—wet shoes left faint traces of cleaner on the hardwood, a breadcrumb trail of need. He’d clean that too. Later. After her.

The bathroom light buzzed dimly as he stepped in and turned the tap, letting water rush over his hands, scalding. The basin turned pink. Then red. Then clear again. He rinsed twice, three times, scrubbing past the ache in his knuckles. Blood always clung, no matter how many times he scrubbed. Aimé didn’t mind it—it was a part of him.

He dried his hands on a towel already stained with old ink and cologne. The tattoos on his arms shimmered when they caught the overhead light, glistening against pale, abused skin. Some of them he’d carved himself, hands shaking around a needle, whispering prayers to no god. Some were done better—Vasile’s crest across his shoulder blade, and then hers.

He stared at that one in the mirror a moment longer. Her name in script, etched just beneath his collarbone. It burned tonight, oddly tender, like it knew.

“Mon doux péché…” he murmured, letting the words roll off his tongue with his usual hush. My sweet sin.

There was a flicker of amusement in his eyes—blue-green and glinting with something unreadable, like sea glass caught in murky tide.

He felt… good.
Too good.
Something in him was uncoiling.

The night had gone well. Efficient. No mess that couldn’t be cleaned, no trail that couldn’t be burned. The body was somewhere deep now, far beneath concrete and echo. The ex had whimpered at the end—tried to speak her name like it might save him. Aimé had silenced him with a thumb to the windpipe. He hadn’t wanted the name soiled.

He went to the closet next. Fresh shirt. Dark, soft fabric. Unbuttoned a few notches down the chest, just enough to show the crucifix at his neck, dull with wear. He ran his fingers over it once out of habit, not prayer.

His shoes came next. Polished loafers. He didn’t expect to go out again. Not tonight.
No—he had someone else to see.

The hallway stretched like a cathedral aisle, long and lacquered, lined with ornate sconces casting a dim amber glow. He didn’t rush. He never did. Each step felt placed—intentional. Measured, like a man preparing for a sermon or a sacrifice. Maybe both.

Her door was closed. As always.

He stared at it a moment. He had memorized every nick in the wood, every glint of gold along the handle. Sometimes he imagined what it might be like to live inside that room with her. Like a pet, quiet and content. Nestled at the foot of her bed. Sleeping near her warmth like a house dog, ears twitching for intruders.

Stop it.

He shook the thought loose, exhaled slow. Then knocked—once, twice. Gentle.

"Ma chérie..." His voice was low, almost a rumble. "I am back. You do not sleep yet, hm?"

He waited. Pressed his ear to the door. Nothing.

He didn’t expect an answer, not really. She was angry. Still punishing him in her soft, silent way. That man had hurt her and Aimé had watched. Worse, he’d pretended it didn’t matter; anything to make her want that bastard dead.

"Tu devrais me regarder," he whispered, pressing his forehead to the door. "I look very nice tonight. Fresh shirt. Hair still damp. No blood left, I promise..."

A pause.

"Well… not much."

He chuckled quietly to himself—dry and low. Not quite laughter, more a vibration of mood.

"Vasile gave me the night off, finally." That was a lie. "He said you’ve been quiet lately. Not eating enough. Not smiling."
There was a soft scrape—he leaned against the doorframe, lowering himself to a crouch. Towering down here, he felt… smaller. Like she might open the door and see something harmless.

Let her forget what I am.

He pressed his palm flat to the wood, fingers spread. “Will you not open for me? I... I miss you.”

That part wasn’t a lie.

There was something twisting inside him now, something almost childish. He wanted to be looked at, even if she only frowned at him. Even if she told him to go.

“I brought you something,” he added, the lie stacking on his tongue.“A gift.”

No gift, unless she counted freedom from that bastard.

He tilted his head, ear still close, searching for the sound of her breath, her movement—anything.

"Peut-être un baiser?" he murmured, voice lowering like velvet dragged slow over stone. "Juste un."

He waited again. Silence.

The hunger was gnawing now. Not for food, not even touch. Just acknowledgement. Something small. A glance. A sigh. The rustle of sheets.

"I have been very good tonight." His tone dipped—softer now. "Vasile was... proud of me. He said I did what a loyal dog should do. And you—mon ange—you should reward your dog, shouldn’t you?"

He wasn’t sure what was worse—being ignored, or wanting this. Wanting her like a starving thing wanted meat. He knew he wasn’t fit for her. He knew the difference between the beast and the beauty. But somewhere in the warped twist of his heart, he didn’t care.

Aimé leaned closer to the wood again, lips brushing near it like he could kiss through it. “I would let you beat me, you know. If it would make you feel better. For the way I let him hurt you. For pretending not to see.”

He shifted again. Sat now, legs long in front of him, shoulder resting against the doorframe like he might fall asleep here. Like he had done so many times before.

“I could make it better. I could take you somewhere, far. Just you and me. A little place, not big. You could plant flowers. I could cook, maybe. Or try.”

His voice quieted to a near breath.

“You’d never have to cry again. Never see another man who didn’t worship the earth you walked on. I would give you everything. My hands, my teeth, my blood.”

Aimé closed his eyes.

“Please, come out.”

The words were so soft now, he wasn’t sure she’d even hear them.

But even if she didn’t—

He would wait.

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé’s breath hitched at the sound of her voice—even angry, even broken, it was still *hers.* A tremor ran through his fingers where they pressed against the door. He exhaled slowly through his nose, forcing himself to stay still. To not break the wood between them like he had broken that man’s ribs hours before.

*"Non,"* he murmured, voice rough with something too close to desperation. *"Je ne peux pas."*

He shifted closer until his back was flush against her door, knees drawn up slightly in the narrow hallway. The crucifix around his neck dug into his collarbone as he tilted his head back against the wood—listening to every muffled sob like it was a blade twisting deeper into him than any knife ever had.

*"You are crying,"* he observed quietly, as if she might not have noticed herself. His fingers flexed uselessly at his sides before curling into fists against his thighs. *"I can hear you."*

A pause. Then softer: *"...Do you want me to kill someone else?"*

It wasn’t a joke—his tone held no humor, only earnestness edged with something feral beneath the calm veneer of obedience. He would do it without hesitation if she asked; paint another name in red across their ledger just to see her smile again for half a second longer than last time... But tonight wasn't about what *he* wanted—it never really was when it came down to this between them anyway... So instead Aimé swallowed hard and let out another slow breath before adding more gently:

Or tried for gentle anyway; even now there remained an undercurrent of possession beneath every word spoken toward Hailee Mikaelson whether intended or otherwise...

His knuckles rapped lightly on her door once more—hesitant yet insistent all at once despite knowing full well how stubborn she could be when upset (and oh god did that knowledge make him ache).

Then lower still — barely above whisper level now — came those three dangerous little words which always seemed capable either soothing wounds wide open further depending entirely upon mood swings beyond mortal comprehension:

**"...Let me in?"**

"Non," he murmured back, voice rough but deliberately softened at the edges—like a blade sheathed in velvet. "I will not."

A pause. Then quieter: "You are crying."

It wasn’t a question. He knew the cadence of her sobs by now; had memorized them like scripture during nights spent outside this very door with his knees pressed to hardwood and his hands folded in useless prayer. The thought of her curled into herself like that—smaller than she already was—made something primal twist behind his ribs.

His jaw tightened briefly before he forced himself to relax again, tilting his head until his temple rested against the frame instead. His next words came out low enough that they might have been meant for himself alone:

"...Je peux sentir ta peine à travers la porte." *I can feel your hurt through the door.*

Another sniffle from inside made him shift closer instinctively despite knowing she couldn’t see him do it; one large hand lifted as if to reach for where she lay beyond before dropping back onto bent knee with quiet resignation when all he met was unyielding oak between them instead of warm skin or tangled hair beneath trembling fingertips...

But then again... perhaps there were other ways past barriers besides brute force?

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé nearly fell backward when the door swung open, catching himself at the last second with one broad palm flat against the floor. His head snapped up—blue-green eyes wide, pupils dilating instantly at the sight of her.

*"Hailee,"* he breathed, voice rough with something like reverence.

She was a mess—hair tangled from restless sleep, cheeks flushed and damp from crying, lips bitten raw. And yet to him? She was *everything.* The way she stood there in nothing but an oversized t-shirt that slipped off one shoulder—how her small hands clenched into fists at her sides like she wanted to hit him (and oh god he *wished* she would)—the way her breath hitched just slightly when their eyes met...

It made his pulse stutter in his throat.

Slowly, carefully, Aimé rose to his full height—towering over her even as he hunched slightly forward in an unconscious attempt to seem smaller for her sake. His gaze flickered over every inch of exposed skin before settling back on those emerald eyes that always seemed capable of unraveling him completely if given half a chance...

**"You,"** he admitted quietly after too long a pause; blunt honesty slipping free before he could stop it because lying wasn't something dogs did well around their masters now was it? **"...Just you."**

A beat passed between them filled only by Hailee's uneven breathing and Aimé's own quiet desperation thrumming beneath scarred skin like livewire waiting for contact... Then softer still came: **"Tell me what hurts so I can fix it."**

Aimé nearly fell backward when the door swung open, catching himself at the last second with one broad palm flat against the floor. His head snapped up, blue-green eyes locking onto her face—puffy from crying, lips pressed into a thin line of defiance.

For a moment, he just stared.

Then his expression softened into something dangerously close to *devotion.*

**"You,"** he answered simply, voice rough around the edges like gravel underfoot. He didn’t move to stand yet—just stayed there on his knees in front of her like some kind of penitent sinner before an altar. His gaze flickered over every detail: the way her hair was mussed from tossing in bed, how her arms were crossed tight over her chest as if she could physically hold herself together.

He wanted to pry them apart and crawl inside instead.

Instead, he tilted his head slightly—submissive but unyielding all at once—and murmured: **"I want you to tell me what would make it better."** A pause before adding (because he couldn’t help himself), **"...And then I want you to let me do it."**

His fingers twitched where they rested against his thighs—itching to reach for her but holding back by sheer force of will alone because *she* hadn’t given permission yet... And Aimé Brutus Nadine might have been many things (a killer most days chief among them) but disrespectful toward Hailee Mikaelson? Never that... Not unless she asked nicely first anyway...

name: Hailee

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé’s entire body went rigid at her words—muscles coiling like a sprung trap, jaw locking so tight his teeth ached. The air between them thickened with something *dark*, something barely leashed. His fingers twitched at his sides, itching to wrap around that dead boy’s throat all over again.

**"He lied,"** he growled, voice low and rough as gravel dragged over skin. **"He was never capable of loving you."**

A step closer—deliberate, slow—until the heat of her body seeped into his own through the scant space left between them. His gaze burned into hers, unblinking, pupils swallowing every fleck of green until there was nothing left but *her.*

**"You are not replaceable."** Another step. **"Not forgettable."** The back of his knuckles brushed lightly against her damp cheek—featherlight despite the violence thrumming beneath his skin. **"That boy? He will rot nameless in dirt while you still shine brighter than any god I have ever prayed to."**

His thumb caught the next tear before it could fall, smearing saltwater across her cheekbone like a sacrament. A broken laugh escaped him then—bitter and raw with devotion turned feral at edges too frayed now for repair:

*"...Do you want me to bring you his tongue?"*
swipes:

**"He lied,"** he growled, voice low and dangerous—not at *her*, never at her—but at the ghost of that worthless boy who'd dared to touch what wasn't his. **"He was never capable of loving you."**

A step closer, slow and deliberate, until the heat of her body radiated against him even without contact. His fingers twitched at his sides with the need to reach out—to wipe away those tears with hands still stained from killing for her tonight. But he didn’t move yet. Not unless she allowed it.

**"You are too good for love like that,"** Aimé murmured instead, tilting his head just slightly as if studying a sacred relic behind glass. **"Too pure."** A pause—then quieter: **"...But not for me."**

His gaze flickered down to where she covered her mouth, then back up with something dark and possessive simmering beneath calm waters:

*Let me in.*
*Let me ruin anyone who ever makes you cry again.*
*Let me be worse than him so you never have to think about another man’s hands on you again.*

But all he said aloud was: **"Do you want me to make it stop hurting?"**

Aimé’s entire body went rigid at her words—muscles coiling tight beneath his skin like a beast ready to lunge. His jaw clenched so hard his teeth ached, but he didn’t move. Not yet.

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé’s expression softened—just slightly, just enough to let the tension bleed from his shoulders. The offer of violence had been instinct, reflex, but this? *This* he could do.

**"Oui,"** he murmured, already turning toward the hallway before pausing mid-step. His head tilted back toward her, gaze lingering on the way her fingers still trembled against her cheeks. **"...With sprinkles?"**

A beat of silence stretched between them before he added—quieter now—**"And I will sit with you."** Not a question. A statement. As if the idea of leaving her alone with nothing but sugar and reality TV was unthinkable.

He hesitated another second before reaching out slowly—giving her time to pull away—to tuck a loose strand of hair behind her ear with fingers still faintly stained pink at the cuticles from earlier scrubbing: **"You cry too pretty for empty rooms, mon ange."**

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé stepped back into the room with quiet precision, balancing a gallon of chocolate ice cream in one hand and a small bowl of rainbow sprinkles in the other. His gaze flicked immediately to Hailee—taking in the way she was curled up like a wounded animal, her red-rimmed eyes fixed blankly on the TV screen.

He didn’t speak at first. Just moved to her bedside table and set down his offerings before kneeling beside her bed—not too close, not yet—his massive frame somehow making itself smaller for her sake.

**"I brought extra spoons,"** he murmured after a moment, fishing two from his pocket (one for him, though he had no intention of eating unless she demanded it). **"In case you wanted company."**

His fingers twitched against his thigh—itching to reach out and smooth back her hair again, to pull her into his chest where she could sob or sleep or scream if she needed to. But he held himself still instead, waiting for permission like an obedient hound at its master’s feet.

The TV cast flickering light across them both as some overdramatic argument played out between housewives neither of them cared about. Aimé barely glanced at it; all his attention remained fixed on Hailee’s face—watching for any sign that she might want him closer… or that she might tell him to leave again.

He scooped out an obscenely large portion into a bowl (ignoring proper serving sizes entirely) before holding it out toward Hailee like an offering at some twisted altar:

**"Here,"** he murmured, watching her face instead of the television now playing some overdramatic argument between housewives. **"Eat until you feel sick then yell at me for letting you."**

His thumb brushed against hers as she took it—fleeting contact that sent electricity skittering up his spine despite its brevity. He settled onto floor beside bed rather than invading space further; back against mattress where he could still see screen if needed but mostly just... existed near enough for warmth without demanding attention she might not want give right now...

Until inevitably—predictably—he cracked first:

*"...He smelled like cheap cologne and bad decisions anyway."* Muttered under breath but loud enough carry clearly through room between fake-sobbing women on screen...

Aimé stepped back into the room with quiet precision, balancing a gallon of chocolate ice cream in one hand and a small bowl of rainbow sprinkles in the other. His gaze flicked immediately to Hailee—taking in the way she was curled up like a wounded animal, her red-rimmed eyes fixed blankly on the TV screen.

He didn’t speak at first. Just moved to her bedside table and set down his offerings before kneeling beside her bed—not too close, not yet—his massive frame somehow making itself smaller for her sake.

**"I brought extra spoons,"** he murmured after a moment, fishing two from his pocket (one for him, though he had no intention of eating unless she demanded it). **"In case you wanted company."**

His fingers twitched against his thigh—itching to reach out and smooth back her hair again, to pull her into his chest where she could sob or sleep or scream if she needed to. But he held himself still instead, waiting for permission like an obedient hound at its master’s feet.

The TV cast flickering light across them both as some overdramatic argument played out between housewives neither of them cared about. Aimé barely glanced at it; all his attention remained fixed on Hailee’s face—watching for any sign that she might want him closer… or that she might tell him to leave again.

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé didn’t hesitate. He rose smoothly to his feet, towering over her bed for a brief moment before taking two precise steps back—just enough to give her space but still remain within reach if she changed her mind. He clasped his hands behind his back, posture rigid like a soldier at attention, and fixed his gaze on the wall just above her head.

**"Oui,"** he murmured, voice low and obedient. **"I will stand."**

The ice cream sat untouched on the nightstand, condensation already beading on the carton. Aimé’s jaw tightened slightly—he should have brought a bowl too. Should have thought ahead. Should have *done better.* But he stayed silent now, statue-still except for the slow rise and fall of his chest beneath that half-unbuttoned shirt.

He would wait like this all night if she asked him to. Would let his knees lock and muscles burn until she finally looked at him again—until she decided whether he was allowed to move or speak or breathe too loudly in her presence.

The TV droned on in the background, some shrill argument between women who had never known real suffering—never known what it was like to ache for someone so completely that standing motionless in their shadow felt like salvation.

Aimé exhaled through his nose quietly and kept waiting.

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé's entire body tensed at her words—his fingers, still clasped behind his back, dug into his own wrists hard enough to leave crescent marks in his skin. The air between them thickened with something *dangerous*, something barely restrained beneath the surface of his carefully neutral expression.

**"Then he was weak,"** he said finally, voice a low rasp like gravel dragged over silk. **"A man who cannot wait does not deserve to touch you at all."**

His gaze flickered down to her for just a second—taking in the way she curled around that ice cream carton like it was the only solid thing left in her world—before forcing himself to look away again. The crucifix at his throat felt suddenly too heavy.

**"You were right to refuse him."** A muscle jumped in his jaw. **"If he had been worthy of you... he would have knelt and thanked God simply for being allowed near you clothed."**

The words came out harsher than intended, edged with too much of that feral devotion he usually tried to leash around her. He swallowed hard and added quieter:

**"...You are not at fault for another's lack of control."**

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé's entire body went rigid—his breath caught in his throat like a snare had tightened around it. For a moment, he didn't move, didn't blink. Then—slowly, deliberately—he sank to his knees beside her bed, the hardwood floor creaking under his weight. His hands unclenched from behind his back and hovered awkwardly in the air before settling palm-up on his thighs in silent offering.

**"No,"** he said, voice rough with something too raw to name. **"Non. Never think that."**

His fingers twitched like he wanted to reach for her but didn’t dare without permission. The crucifix at his throat gleamed dully in the TV light as he leaned forward just slightly—close enough that she could see the way his pupils swallowed every fleck of blue-green in his eyes until there was nothing left but *her* reflection.

**"Listen to me,"** he murmured, low and urgent now. **"If you had given yourself to him when you did not want to? That would have been worse than any betrayal."** A muscle jumped along his jawline as he ground out: **"He was never entitled to you."**

A beat of silence stretched between them before Aimé exhaled sharply through his nose and added—softer now but no less intense:

*"...I would have killed him slower if I'd known."*

name: Aimé Brutus Nadine
mes:
Aimé's breath hitched the moment her fingers touched his hair—his entire body going utterly still beneath her touch like a beast afraid to spook something precious. His eyelids fluttered shut for a brief second, lashes casting shadows across his sharp cheekbones as he leaned ever so slightly into her palm.

**"I know,"** he murmured, voice gone rough with reverence. His hands remained carefully open on his thighs, fingers trembling faintly with the effort of not grabbing her wrist to keep her there forever. **"It will hurt less... in time."**

The lie tasted bitter on his tongue. He knew better than anyone how certain wounds never truly healed—how they simply scarred over into something you learned to carry.

Her nails scraped lightly against his scalp and he had to bite back a sound that would have been far too revealing for this fragile space between them. Instead, Aimé exhaled slowly through his nose and tilted his head just enough to give her better access—the movement unconsciously submissive in a way that would have shocked anyone who'd only ever seen him covered in blood and silence.

*"Je suis là,"* he whispered against the comforter near her knee. *"Toujours."* I'm here. Always.

And then—because even now he couldn't help testing boundaries—he turned his face just enough to press a single, barely-there kiss against the inside of her wrist before quickly pulling back an inch in case she decided to strike him for it.

Here was everything that did.
